text:
After restarting tomcat and apache the first
hit to a servlet using basic authentication
you will not need to enter username/password
as stated in tomcat-users.xml and defined in
MYWEBAPPDIR/WEB-INF/web.xml when having other
contexts using no basic authentication.

<webapp>
	<servlet>
		<servlet-name>PLServlet</servlet-name>
		<servlet-class>at.lgsoft.ecom.pl.PLServlet</servlet-class>
	</servlet>	
	<servlet-mapping>
		<servlet-name>PLServlet</servlet-name>
		<url-pattern>/p</url-pattern>
	</servlet-mapping>

	(...)
	
	<security-constraint>
		<web-resource-collection>
			<web-resource-name>Protected Area</web-resource-name>
			<url-pattern>/p</url-pattern>
			<http-method>DELETE</http-method>
			<http-method>GET</http-method>
			<http-method>POST</http-method>
			<http-method>PUT</http-method>
		</web-resource-collection>
		<auth-constraint>
			<role-name>MYROLE</role-name>
		</auth-constraint>
	</security-constraint>
	<login-config>
		<auth-method>BASIC</auth-method>
		<realm-name>MYREALM</realm-name>
	</login-config>
</webapp>
creator: t.bezdicek@lgsoft.at
nacho@apache.org
text:
Please add some more info.
Which browser? 
Restarting the browser before accessing the servlet, make any difference?
If you continue accessing the servlet, the login dialog pops up later?

creator: t.bezdicek@lgsoft.at
text:
This behavior occures after restarting, if the browser (IE 5.5)
is not closed, then there is no need to reauthenticate. this
seems to be very strange, because the tomcat-session-cookies
should avoid this, but in fact they dont. the login is not
presented later.

creator: nacho@apache.org
text:
This is not a bug.

Is how known browsers deal with BASIC auth, If the browser is not closed in 
between Tomcat restarts, When a request requires BASIC auth and the User 
authentocate itself, the browser stores the auth string sended and append it to 
every request made to the same server.. until browser is restarted...Give it a 
try with apache .. you will see the same behavior....

I will close the bug with a WORKSFORME resolution..

Thanks for your help.
